meanings.definition: The study of the structure and organization of the nervous system.
meanings.sent1: In neuroanatomy, we learn about how the brain and nerves work together.
meanings.sent2: She found neuroanatomy fascinating and enjoyed studying the brain's structure.
meanings.sent3: The neuroanatomy class was so interesting that even the sleepy students perked up.
meanings.sent4: Exploring the neuroanatomy of the brain is like deciphering a complex puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The professor made neuroanatomy come alive with detailed diagrams and explanations.

meanings.definition: The branch of anatomy that deals with the structure of the nervous system.
meanings.sent1: Understanding neuroanatomy helps us comprehend how our nerves function.
meanings.sent2: Doctors specializing in neuroanatomy focus on the nervous system's intricacies.
meanings.sent3: The neuroanatomy textbook was so heavy that it could be used as a weight.
meanings.sent4: The complexity of neuroanatomy is like navigating a maze of nerve pathways.
meanings.sent5: She visualized the neuroanatomy of the brain as a network of electrical wires.
